title: Developer Panel talk with Free-Code-Camp-Indy
description: On a panel as a mid-level developer giving tips on several topics. Open question and answering panel.

title: Started working at Angie's list
description: Hired in as a Software Engineer II (SEII) focusing on front-end development. Hoping to grow in my role to include backend.

title: Started working for Heartland FPG
description: In charge of email marketing markup in Sales Force Marketing Cloud, converted websites to Wordpress sites hosted through pantheon and version controlled via Lando. Seriously, check out lando. It imports your database and files so you can use it like git.

title: Finished Schabel-Realty.com
description: Responsive website redesign for Schabel-Realty.com for the Schabel Property Management Group. Integrated IDX (Internet Data Exchange) to show housing listings with the website, designed logo, new business card design, and colorized a black & white photo to display on the main page.

title: Redesigned SilverDoorSpa.com
description: Responsive website redesign for Silver Door Spa a spa based out of Carmel, IN. Integrated with service to help clients schedule appointments.

title: Started working for Rook Security
description: Started as their Front End Developer helping crystalize designs and update styles on an in-house SOC supplemental security threat application.

title: Contributed to Open Source Project
description: Contributed to the Scout.io app open source project. Used a js library and consumed API data to update donut charts displaying the number of downloads based on operating systems through different versions.

title: Became a Team Leader
description: Became the Team Leader of the Developers and Designers in the FreeCodeCamp Indy Meetup. The idea is to make a website to gather our campers. Check out our progress here

title: Started a blog
description: Started a developer blog as the result of a FreeCodeCamp meetup.

title: Joined INDY.js and Node.js
description: Found out about local meetups in Indianapolis.

title: Started FreeCodeCamp
description: At Indy.js I learned about FreeCodeCamp to learn front end skills.

title: Exhibited at Indy Pop Con
description: Sold my illustrations, graphic novel, and attended panels.

title: First public showing of R&tR
description: At a local convention called INDYpendent Self-publisher's show, participated in panels on self-publishing, giving and taking critique, and character creation.

title: Published Reggie and the Rabbit
description: After the success of the indiegogo I was able to publish my comic through both Holon Publishing and Brinkman Printers.

title: Finished Reggie and the Rabbit
description: Finished R&tR and self published. Was approached by Holon Publishing, an artist collective and publishing house out of Bloomington.

title: Joined Holon Publishing as author and illustrator
description: Joined Holon Publishing and entered publishing deal to distribute R&tR.

title: Started senior project Reggie and the Rabbit
description: Set out to create, illustrate, write, and publish my own comic book. Links above in projects.

title: Started Reggie and the Rabbit Indiegogo
description: Ran a successful indiegogo campaign to help fund publication.

title: Started Mattattaq.com
description: Created my own comic based on WordPress to display my comic and maintained weekly page releases.

title: Exhibited at Indiana Comic Con
description: Sold my illustrations, graphic novel, and attended panels.

title: Started working at Trivas Consulting
description: Hired as Computer Programmer and Graphic Design Specialist.

title: Graduated IUPUI
description: Graduated with a Bachelor's in Informatics.

title: Exhibited at INDYpendent Self-Publisher's Show
description: Helped local artists actualize their ideas and sold my new comic It's All Downhill From Here.

title: Volunteered at Indy Pop Con
description: Helped run photo booths, managed lines, and helped give guests directions and water if needed.

title: Volunteered at Indiana Comic Con
description: Managed lines, helped with celebrity signings, and helped give guests directions and water if needed.

title: Started College
description: Started at Indiana University - Purdue University Indianapolis (IUPUI) on New Media.

title: Graduated High School
description: Graduated 2006 from James Madison High School.

title: Free Code Camp Indy Talk
description: Gave an online talk for Free Code Camp Indy Talk on Learning a New Programming Language

title: Promotion to Software Engineer III
description: Worked on primarily backend microservices in Scala fetching data from a MariaDb database after moving our Drupal stack to micro front-end apps in Next.js.

title: Promotion to Senior Software Engineer
description: Started gaining more responsibility to architect solutions around dynamically creating sitemaps using the Slug table and a Scala ETL (extract - transform - load) cron jobs through Jenkins and files hosted on s3. Here is an example. Each XML file is created by template type.

title: Moved teams
description: Moved from Brew-Tang Clan whose primary function was all the SEO traffic and template types on the micro front-end apps to SEM pages team SEMantics who were architecting a new hosting solution for template pages on cloudflare instead of the apps hosted through akamai. Tech stack changed a little: front end next, typescript and backend kotlin, java, and some shared scala services used as proxies to call java/kotlin services.

title: Angie's List is now Angi redesign
description: After the merger with HomeAdvisor under the IAC umbrella Angie's List went through a redesign which included focusing primarily on home services which included a refactor of front-end apps to match design, consolidation on data services, and decommissioning non-home services.

title: Project Hydra
description: After the merger with HomeAdvisor and Angie's List it took awhile to combine the pool of service providers. Project Hydra was an initiative to fetch HomeAdvisor pros on Angi and hydrate the featured pros while flattening the complexity on the two stacks and flattening the data points, and giving all service providers UUIDs instead of each system's own service-provider id. I was in charge of architecting the common services, how the stacks would interact, and how the fetching operations would work as well as consolidating the UUID pointers on the Angi database.

title: CustomForge redesign
description: Contributed to the template and design for the custom dlc search engine associated with Custom Forge which is an open source project to extend the functionality and custom downloadable content hub for the Ubisoft guitar learning game RockSmith 2014. Ignition4 is build using Laravel a PHP framework.
